security_audit.summary: This is documentation for a legitimate static analysis security tool. The installation uses standard curl commands with GitHub URLs. The tool's purpose (bug scanning) matches its capabilities (static code analysis). No malicious patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Remote installation script execution
low_findings.description: Installation uses curl to download and execute remote scripts from GitHub. While this is common practice, it introduces supply chain risk if the repository is compromised.

content.user_title: Scan code for bugs before committing
content.value_statement: AI coding agents introduce bugs that reach production. UBS catches null safety issues, security vulnerabilities, async/await problems, and memory leaks in 8 languages before you commit.
actual_capabilities: Detects 18 bug categories across 8 programming languages
Runs in 3-5 seconds on typical code changes
Integrates with Claude Code, Cursor, and other AI agents
Provides specific fix suggestions for each finding
Supports CI/CD with JSON and SARIF output formats
Auto-configures pre-commit hooks for quality gates
limitations: Static analysis only - cannot catch runtime logic errors
May have false positives that need suppression

use_cases.title: Quality gate before commits
use_cases.description: Automatically scan code changes before committing to catch bugs AI agents commonly introduce like missing await or null safety issues.

use_cases.title: CI/CD security scanning
use_cases.description: Integrate into build pipelines to prevent security vulnerabilities and code quality issues from reaching production.

use_cases.title: Contributor code review
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent code quality across pull requests by catching common patterns that lead to bugs or security issues.

best_practices: Always scan staged files before committing to catch issues early
Fix the root cause, not just the symptom - use proper patterns like optional chaining
Integrate UBS into your AI agent's file write hooks for automatic scanning
anti_patterns: Ignoring findings without investigation - verify each issue is a false positive before suppressing
Running full project scans on every save - scope scans to changed files for speed
Fixing symptoms instead of root causes - use proper language features like null coalescing

faq.question: Is UBS compatible with my programming language?
faq.answer: UBS supports JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, Go, Rust, Java, C++, Ruby, and Swift with language-specific detection patterns.

faq.question: What are the scanning limits?
faq.answer: UBS handles 10,000+ lines per second. A 200K line project scans in 12 seconds. Use file scoping for faster results.

faq.question: How do I integrate UBS with my existing tools?
faq.answer: UBS auto-configures hooks for Claude Code, Cursor, Codex CLI, and other AI agents. Manual integration available for any editor.

faq.question: Is my code safe during scanning?
faq.answer: UBS performs static analysis only - it reads your code without executing it. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: How do I fix 'ast-grep not found' errors?
faq.answer: Run 'ubs doctor --fix' to auto-install dependencies, or manually install ast-grep via brew or cargo.

faq.question: How does UBS compare to other linters?
faq.answer: UBS focuses on AI-specific bug patterns and security issues that traditional linters miss, with 3-5 second scan times.
